channel.title: Allan's Notes
channel.description: Content from Allan's notes, via RSS.

item.title: Resolving CORS errors in SvelteKit
item.description: Cross-origin resource sharing requests let a user access resources on one site from another, but only if the server performs the secret CORS handshake with the browser.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Type branding removes structural type compatibility
item.description: A structural type can be "branded" to add context to values by using the type system for annotations as is done with nominal types. Doing so makes them incompatible with structurally equivalent types.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Total Typescript notes
item.description: I've learned a lot from this course, and use this note to record bits I want to remember and riff on some of my observations.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Pasta Arabica
item.description: An improvised pasta dish made to drawn inspiration from the flavors and sounds of the Middle East. It is hearty and surprisingly bright.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: TypeScript assertion functions increase type safety
item.description: Assertion functions let the programmer narrow types using a named function, making type narrowing much more readable.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Make API misuse hard
item.description: Being hard to misuse is an underrated characteristic of exceptional APIs, especially when the possibility needs to be exposed to the client for advanced scenarios.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The publishing pipeline for allandeutsch.com
item.description: An overview of how I avoided needing to copy+paste my notes into blogging software to publish them.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Svelte component APIs
item.description: There are many ways to Svelte a component...
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Slugs make links readable
item.description: Special characters aren't valid in URLs, so custom slugs are used to make links easier to read.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Structural types increase data compatibility
item.description: Structural types are only concerned with the shape of data, rather than the names of types. This makes data types more compatible.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Playa del Carmen travel guide
item.description: Tips from my travels to PDC, including where to eat, stay, and visit!
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Mac tips
item.description: Various tips, hotkeys, and software I use on my Mac that I find to be broadly helpful and think everyone should know about.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Adding users to new teams with Lucia auth and Prisma
item.description: When building a B2B product, most customers will want to invite their team members. This post explores how I added support for that to Penguinsight, a user feedback SaaS I'm building.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Seattle area caf√©s I like
item.description: A curated list of my favorite Seattle area cafes to sit, sip, and relax or work.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Value proposition
item.description: The way(s) a product or service benefits its target customers and the statement describing it.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Restaurants I like
item.description: A list of some of my favorite places to get a meal in the Seattle area.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: I want a smaller phone
item.description: As a tech guy, I'm often interested in the latest and greatest gadget. This has historically meant the biggest and best smart phone, but no longer...
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: git-cheatsheet
item.description: Some common scenarios and how to resolve them using git.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: 10 questions to evaluate a startup idea
item.description: 10 questions to ask about any startup idea that will help you evaluate if it's worth pursuing.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Reflections on work-life balance
item.description: These are my reflections on how I view work-life balance, and how that view has changed over time.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Cozumel travel guide
item.description: A brief guide on having a successful trip to the SCUBA diving island paradise of Mexico, Cozumel.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Cross-Price Elasticity of Demand (CPED)
item.description: Microeconomics tool for quantifying the change in demand for a product in response to price changes for substitute goods.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Positioning statement
item.description: A position statement explains how a product fits into its market.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Price Elasticity of Demand (PED)
item.description: Price changes impact the demand for goods and services. PED is a microeconomics tool for quantifyng that impact.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Money market
item.description: The market for currency and the mechanics that govern it, such as interest rates, money supply, and the required reserve ratio.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Setting up a SvelteKit project with Storybook
item.description: Setting up Storybook on a SvelteKit project doesn't work out of the box using the config tool. This guide walks you through a few extra steps needed to get SvelteKit and Storybook running.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Avocado toast
item.description: Perhaps the icon of a generation, avocado toast is a delicious and nutritious way to start the day.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Present three options to build consensus
item.description: Cognitive biases lead people to evaluate options in context. There are strong biases that impact decision making when there are one or two options.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Single-option aversion bias
item.description: People are biased against deciding on a single option. Multiple options enable people to compare and make informed decisions.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Microeconomics
item.description: An overview of my notes on microeconomics.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Costs of production
item.description: Understanding the costs facing a business is an important part of evaluating its profitability. There are two categories of costs - fixed and variable.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Opportunity cost
item.description: The most valuable alternative that must be given up.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Price elasticity
item.description: Price elasticity measures how much the demand for a good changes in response to price changes.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Consumer demand
item.description: Consumer demand looks at the three types of relationships between goods and how price changes to one product affects demand for another.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Marginal utility
item.description: The incremental value gained from have one more of something.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Market forces
item.description: The factors that impact the price of goods and services, which in turn drives supply and demand changes.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Supply and demand
item.description: An area of microeconomics focused on how price influences the behavior of producers and consumers.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Great UI shadows imitate real shadows
item.description: UI shadows should create an illusion of depth. For the best illusion, imitate reality.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The principal-agent problem
item.description: When there is a conflict in priorities between one party (the principal) and another party (the agent) that executions on their behalf.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Grapow
item.description: Grapow is a sweet & spicy Thai dish made with ground meat, Thai chilis, and Thai basil. This dish is often requested by friends joining for dinner.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Improve site previews on social media by unfurling webpages
item.description: Some webpages have nice previews when shared on social media. These can be specified in the page HTML. Previews make the site user-friendly before users even visit it!
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Value innovation
item.description: Value innovation is how companies offer dramatically higher value at lower costs, escaping competition.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Use contrast to direct attention
item.description: Visual focus is naturally drawn to contrast. Use contrast in design to direct attention.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Make hard decisions quickly
item.description: The less differentiated the options are, the harder it is to choose one.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Type-1 and Type-2 Decisions
item.description: A decision dichotomy based on if the decision can be mitigated or reversed.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Ask, don't tell
item.description: Giving unprompted advice is ineffective. Instead, lead people to ask for advice.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Vicious and virtuous cycles
item.description: Self-reinforcing cycles that act as compound growth systems. Negative cycles are vicious, positive cycles are virtuous.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Categories of customer attributes
item.description: Customer attributes can be grouped as demographic, psychographic, geographic, or behavior.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The fundamental habits
item.description: These simple behaviors are often challenging, but provide a rock solid foundation for the rest of life.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Utility
item.description: Utility is the microeconomics concept for how much satisfaction, pain reduction, happiness, or value a buyer gets from a product or service.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Blue Ocean
item.description: Blue oceans are markets that haven't been created yet. They are lucrative business opportunities.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning (STP)
item.description: Group consumers into segments, determine which to target, and estable the product's position for them.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Common traits of successful blue ocean strategies
item.description: Great strategies have a clear focus, diverge from competition, and are easy to explain.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Value curve
item.description: The line on a strategy canvas showing the emphasis a company places on each factor of competition in its industry.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Blue Ocean strategy
item.description: Blue ocean strategy is about creating new markets to escape competition.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Factors of competition
item.description: The factors that companies/products within an industry typically compete on to provide value to customers.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The Four Actions framework
item.description: Helps identify which factors a business should eliminate, reduce, raise, and create. Typically used with a strategy canvas.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The strategy canvas
item.description: An analytical tool that shows how much emphasis companies place on value areas in their industry.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Red ocean
item.description: Crowded markets where customers have many options to choose from, resulting in cutthroat competition.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Business Model Canvas
item.description: A modern alternative to a business plan. It has 9 sections with details of the business, its customers, and how it provides value.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Customer relationship
item.description: The interactions a business has with customers and the strategies around those interactions.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Build infrastructure after not having it becomes painful
item.description: The pain caused by a lack of infrastructure proves the infrastructure is necessary.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Distribution channel
item.description: Distribution channels are how products and services get from a business to its customers.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Monetized content creation is a compound growth system
item.description: New content creates new organic inbound traffic and retains the audience. Old content creates more value from new audience.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Compound growth is most impactful at the end
item.description: Compound growth is exponential. Each compounding period generates more growth than the previous one.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Compound growth system
item.description: Any system in which growth is proportional to the principal, added to that principal, and then repeated.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Customer segment
item.description: The groups of people a business aims to serve.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Situation analysis
item.description: A tool for identifying and evaluating the market conditions for a product or service.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The learning process
item.description: A repeating cycle of receiving input, processing it to create output, evaluating that output, and evaluating results to improve future processing.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: My spaced repetition workflow
item.description: The setup and workflow I use to retain what I learn and deepen my understanding.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: The world is recursive
item.description: The same things happen across domains and contexts all over the world. Very little is unique or novel.
item.author: Allan Deutsch

item.title: Give mostly positive feedback
item.description: Both positive and negative feedback are important, but on high performing teams positive feedback outweighs constructive feedback 5 to 1.
item.author: Allan Deutsch
